name: UCA SOPPEXCCA R.L
description:
UCA SOPPEXCCA R.L es una Unión de Cooperativas Agropecuarias y Servicios integrada por 18 cooperativas que asocian a 650 pequeños productores/as de café ubicada en el Departamento de Jinotega, tiene como misión constituirse como un brazo organizativo, económico, social y ambiental para beneficios de sus asociados y sus comunidades.
En cumplimiento a su misión UCA SOPPEXCCA en su proceso de trabajo ha venido paulatinamente desarrollando una estrategia de apropiación de la cadena de producción – exportación de café que permita en el mediano plazo alcanzar sostenibilidad económica, organizacional, ambiental, comercial y social. 
De igual manera se ha construido un Sistema de Control de Calidad Interno, en el cual se definen las relaciones socio-cliente, cliente-socio, en la interactuación y vinculación de todos los procesos de trabajo que además de dar un servicio también vamos creando un patrimonio para la organización y sus asociados/as.

ADISA, esta organizada en 09 comités sectoriales ; y en la actualidad agrupa a 139 familias productoras de café activas en los ámbitos de los distritos de pardo Miguel y Nueva Cajamarca en la región San Martín; los distritos de La Peca , Copallin  y Yambrasbamba en la región amazonas   y en la comunidad de Huacapampa Cañaris en la región Lambayeque

name: Asociación de Productores de café Orgánico Sierra Nevada
description:
ASOPROCAFE es el sueño organizativo de cincuenta familias que en la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, específicamente en Chimila, El Copey- Cesar producen café orgánico FLO con los más altos estándares de calidad para el mercado global.

Es también la tradición del trabajo campesino que se hace poniendo todo el amor en las semillas que germinan sobre la tierra abonada, en la plántula que crece de un verde intenso, en el desyerbe a machete, el abono cien por ciento natural, el riego con lluvia del cielo, la recolección tradicional del grano maduro, el fermentado con aguas que bajan de las montañas, el secado al sol y al aire, y el transporte a lomo de mula hasta la plaza de mercado.

Nuestro café no es solo un café, es el fruto de la vida hecha con trabajo honesto. La vida que nos bebemos gota a gota, que nos mantiene despiertos y siempre con deseos de otra taza.

FICHA TÉCNICA
Altura: 1.000 - 1.800 msnm
Variedades: Típica, Colombia y Castillo
Proceso: Lavado, semi-lavado y natural
Tipo de exposición: Bajo Sombra
Tipo de secado: Bajo Sol
Características sensoriales:  Aroma pronunciado, acidez media-cítrica, cuerpo alto, sabor limpio y nuez, atributos a miel, caramelo y naranja.

name: KOAKAKA COOPERATIVE
description:
Koakaka Cooperative was created in 2003 and today has 1,316 producer-members of which 297 are women, with 745.000 coffee trees at an Altitude of 1685-2000m.
We are located in the South Province of Rwanda, at the edge of Nyungwe rainforest, protected natural reserve and green lung of the region. 
We collect coffee cherries from implemented 70 collection centers operating in 3 different districts. 
Now we are operating from three coffee washing stations: Karambi, Muganza and Gaseke established in 2003, 2015 and 2017 respectively. 
As a cooperative we have gradually increased where we own a coffee plantation of about 4 Ha and more than 7,500 coffee trees.  
We work closely with our partner RWASHOSCCO which is a coffee exporter worldwide. 
Ensuring that our members can produce high quality coffee sustainably and independently is our biggest priority. 
Our aim is to prepare and share our coffee to the Rwandan and international market. We are also producing and processing women coffee.

name: Union de Cooperativas Multisectoriales UCA Miraflor R.L
ACODIHUE
description:
La Asociación de Cooperación al Desarrollo Integral de Huehuetenango, ACODIHUE, es una organización de segundo nivel, está conformada por asociaciones de primer nivel que a su vez están integradas por comités comunales y estos por pequeños productores. Por su diversidad étnica en su conformación de base se identifica como una asociación pluricultural y multilingüe, en donde existen representantes de nueve etnias.
Desarrolla actividades y esfuerzos para contribuir a la reducción de la pobreza extrema e inseguridad alimentaria.  Asimismo, contribuye conproyectos cofinanciados por la cooperación internacional, nacional y el Gobierno de Guatemala, en áreas de: a) Salud, b) Educación, c) Seguridad Alimentaria,  d) Equidad de Género,  e) Producción Agropecuaria, y  f) Restauración, Conservación y Protección del medio ambiente.
El café de ACODIHUE proviene del 71% de las mujeres indígenas productoras de café, que crece en el territorio montañoso de los Cuchumatanes, Huehuetenango, con una altitud promedio de 1,500 metros (4,920 pies) sobre el nivel del mar, lo que proporciona un saneamiento natural del territorio, cuidadosamente conservado de forma respetuosa con el medio ambiente, con el fin de obtener café estrictamente duro (SHB), con características organolépticas especiales que mantienen su calidad a través de una forma tradicional de procesamiento: fermentación natural, selección manual y secado al sol realizado por manos de mujeres

They bundled their strengths in small farming and put a money rotation system in place, to be able to help each other grow. Back then, coffee was only a small part of the association, there was no profitable market for coffee cherries as there was no washing station in area.  At Sholi we care greatly about our environmental impact. to produce the best quality coffee, we make sure we treat our earth and trees with care.

name: Kivubelt Coffee (Teuscher Invest Ltd)
description:
Kivubelt Coffee is 100% pure high quality Arabica Speciality Coffee grown on the shores of lake Kivu in Rwanda. The high evaluation, the humid equatorial mist from the lake Kivu, and the rich volcanic soils emanating from the Virunga volcanoes create an ideal terroir for this unique coffee bean. Known for its high quality, Kivubelt Coffee is exported to all 5 Continents.

Kivubelt Coffee aims to produce highest quality coffee using best sustainable agricultural practices and processing. We own and operate three large farms with more than 90,000 coffee trees and two coffee washing stations in the villages of Murundo and Jarama. We are working closely with smallholders in the region as part of our mission to leverage our coffee expertise for positive social impact.

Kivubelt Coffee was founded in 2011 with the vision of vertical integration of production on our own farms and  production of small holders. We are working with the communities around our Washing Stations delivering technical assistance on coffee quality and agronomy and supporting local education and health care initiatives. More than 500 families participate delivering their cherry to our Washing Stations every year and earning additional premiums they did not earn before.

name: CENCOIC

Contribuye al mejoramiento y bienestar de la calidad de vida de sus socios, su familia y su comunidad, promoviendo el desarrollo sostenible y capacidad emprendedora de los mismos, en armonía con el medio ambiente.

name: Aranga AMCOS Ltd.
description: Aranga AMCOS Ltd. is a coffee producer cooperative on the slopes of Mt. Meru. It has about 60 members, who are subsistence farmers, living close by each other in the community of Nkoaranga. Aranga was formed in 2001-2002 when a group of 10 farmers split from an older cooperative that was facing management challenges. The farmers learned how to bring their coffee to the local coffee auction themselves and began building relationships with overseas buyers in order to sell coffee abroad directly. Aranga produces specialty quality coffee and is certified as an organic producer by TOAM.

description: IMPEXCOR Ltd was found in 2008 and is an independent, family-owned coffee processor and exporter. We have 20 washing station countrywide working with around 20,000 coffer farmers. We started with Rain Forest in 2018 and C.A.F.E Practices in 2019. We always defend customer loyalty and serve fine coffee to our buyer mostly honesty in all levels of coffee chain.

name: Endiro Growers LTD
description: Endiro Growers sources specialty grade Arabica coffee from 250 participating smallholder farmers in Eastern Uganda, in Bukalasi and Mattaya villages of Bududa district. The farmers are primarily women and all our farmers groups are women led. Due to the high-quality nature of our specialty grade coffee, farmers are carefully selected and trained on how to grow and handle coffee from the tree. Primary processing is done at farmer harvest sites. Farmers receive hands-on training and equipment from Endiro to increase crop yield and quality. Endiro supervises production, tests quality, purchases the coffee at site and arranges transport to export grading factory for processing.

name: Dannys Coffee

Altitud 1,600 masl.

name: BOSNICA
description:
BOSNICA is a Canadian / Nicaraguan non-for-profit that works with about 500 smallholder Coffee farmers in Nicaragua to reforest underused farmland. We give farmers financial incentives to grow trees alongside local training and support to connect their Forest products (Coffee and Woodcraft) to markets. The result is a solution which tackles climate change while helping hondred of farmers build sustainable livelihoods. 

When farmers earn an income from growing trees, climate change and poverty are addressed simultaneously.

name: COOMCAFE R.L.
description: Somos una Cooperativa compuesta por 174 Pequeños Productores de Cafe. Ubicados en alturas promedio de 1,150 MSNM, en la Cordillera Isabelia, producimos, procesamos y exportamos nuestro producto, cuya oferta anual es de 12,000 quintales oro de exportación. Nuestro café es de alta calidad con puntajes promedio de 83 SCA , acidez media, cuerpo balanceado y un característico sabor achocolatado.

name: Amazônia Agroflorestal
description:
Amazônia Agroflorestal is a social-environmental responsible enterprise in the heart of the Amazonian Rainforest. Idealized by Idesam (Institute of Conservation and Sustainable Development in the Amazon) as a regenerative business, we work together towards the conservation of the forest and the social and economic benefits of the families involved throughout the chain, ranging from the collection of seeds for seedlings production to the commercialization.
Our home is Apuí, a municipality in the south of the state of Amazonas - Brazil, one of the most deforested municipalities in Brazil. Our initiative rescues the traditions of family agriculture in the region, with the use of suitable and accessible technologies to producers, regenerating the soil, diversifying production and looking after the water.
Our production is made in agroforestry systems, which is a regenerative form of agriculture. We produce high quality shaded Conilon Coffee, which part of our producers  have organic certification (IBD Brazil).
We aim to foster and strengthen the production chain of "agroecological coffee" in Apuí as a sustainable income generation alternative to hold back deforestation in the municipality.

name: The Green Coffee Company
description: We are a privately held, consolidated farming operation located in Salgar, Antioquia.  Our farming complex in Salgar is comprised of nearly 1,000 hectares spread across 9 farms and 3 wet mills and employs approximately 75 full time workers.  In addition to our office, the main warehouse and laboratory are located in Medellin and are the hub of our operations.  We produce a full range of coffee, from commodity grade up to award winning differentiated and specialty grades.

name: COOPERATIVA AGRARIA CAFETALERA CEPRO YANESHA

name: FEDECOVERA, R.L.

We produce and export: Coffee, Cacao Beans, Allspice, Cardamom, Cardamom Essential Oil and Turmeric; all our products are cultivated by our small-scale scale growers in the Cooperatives,  and all the process and export are done directly by FEDECOVERA, which guarantee 100% traceability.

Organic: Japan-JAS, USDA-NOP, EU and Bio Suisse
Fairtrade by FloCert
Kosher by MercoKosher

name: PRODECOOP R.L

Prodecoop es una organización de segundo grado, formada por 38 cooperativas de primer grado, con sede en Estelí, Madriz y nueva Segovia.

La misión de Prodecoop es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus miembros, sus familias y las comunidades circundantes . La organización esta comprometida con el desarrollo sostenible, trabajando para promover los valores cooperativos, el comercio justo, la equidad de genero, y la adaptación al cambio climático, entre otros.

Later in 2014 the members developed the idea of diversifying their activities and started Unguka Muhinzi with an objective of producing a wide range of specialty coffees, based on the principles of quality, sustainability and traceability. In 4 Cooperatives of 1973 members, that is the Origin of our coffee. The fertile coffee farms are located along side Akagera river and high altitude of 1600-1700 m. working together has greatly improved the life of Rwanda’s coffee farmer. Livelihood has truly changed and the farmers have big hopes in the coffee business.

name: Nyamurinda coffee growers Ltd
description: Nyamurinda coffee growers ltd is a private company located in Rwanda in the southern province, in Nyamagae district more specifically in kibirizi sector. the coffee is grown on a mountain called Nyamurinda. it is a company owned by 2 Rwanda sisters called Mukamana Immaculee and Nyiramana  Francine. after the 1994 genocide their whole family was killed living them the only 2 survivors in their family, they then decied to go back to the region where they were born. they decided to give value to their family land which was not used and they started to grow coffee in 2012. in 2016 they  established their own industry including their own coffee washing station in order to process their own coffee and also the coffee from the neighbouring farmers, especially women coffee in that area. the coffee we produce is purely  bourbon arabica coffee with a hint of vanilla, strawberry, honey, floral, chocolate and other complex fruits.

name: Fa Masa Cooperative
description: SU Fa Masa (237 members) is located in Beiposo village of Bajawa District Ngada Regency. One of the areas that become the center of the production of Flores Bajawa Arabica coffee (AFB). The members' of coffee farms are at an altitude of 1300-1400 m ASL, a type of andosol soil derived from volcanic eruptions. The most widely planted varieties are the arabica types of Lini S795, Kartika and Old Typica (Juria). The harvest period is usually in June-September. The air temperature in Bajawa ranges from 13-23 C, although in the morning the air temperature can reach 8 C (especially in dry months, July-September).

name: ARABIGOS FINOS DE NICARAGUA
description:
Arabigos Finos de Nicaragua is a coffee company which conglomerates farms, processing and exporting.
The entire operation from ground to processing plant fit the highest standards of quality, environmental and social responsibility.
One of the company core value is transparency, which has made the company grow and establish long-term and solid relationships with customers worldwide and locally with our partners.

Reliability is our strength.

name: Mercon BV

We have extensive experience in farming, production, trading, marketing, logistics and risk management in the coffee industry. We are also strongly committed to the sustainability of the coffee industry to generate long-term value and benefits for everyone in the supply chain. Our purpose is to build a better coffee world. We have presence in Brazil, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, Netherlands, Panama, Spain, USA and Vietnam.

name: Associação Agropecuaria Barra Grande de Caconde
description: A nossa Associação atualmente possui 90 associados todos pequenos agricultores familiares , na produção de café e hortifruti, encravado no municipio de Caconde S.P. entre a região montanhosa, serra da Mantigueira  cultivada a 850 a 1300 mt de altitude cuja capacidade de produção do município é de 450.000 scs de 60 kg ou seja  27.000 toneladas anuais sendo que a Associação está com 10% desta produção, podendo aumentar, e por outro lado a Entidade está engajado em produção sustentável, MANEJO BIODINÂMICO , e foi criado o selo de MARCA COLETIVA , com nome REDE-  BIO BRASIL, com protocolo visando produção sustentável, objetivando reconstituição do solo através de adição de Condicionadores de solo, sendo eles: compostagem, rochagem, turfa, palhada, plantio direto, entre outros,  evitando assim a utilização de produtos químicos e herbicidas, cuja conversão se da gradativamente  (3 anos), e ma das principais exigências , todos os associados deverão manter 2 caixa de abelha na propriedade( guardiã de segurança contra uso de pesticida (caso haja morte de abelha há inconformidade) como se trata de projeto novo, estamos necessitando de apoio financeiro e técnico para concretização projeto.

name: ASNIKOM
description: ASNIKOM (Asosiasi Petani Kopi Manggarai or Manggarai Coffee Farmer Organisation) is a coffee farmer cooperative based in Manggarai, East Nusa Tenggara Timur (Flores island), Indonesia.  It has 1062 farmer members that are spread in two regencies (Manggarai and East Manggarai), 8 districts and 29 villages. ASNIKOM farmers produce for types of coffee they are Arabica, Robusta, Yellow Caturra and Juria which are processed with specialty standards and various processing methods.

name: Sorgeba Farmers  Cooperative Union Society
description: The Sorgeba Union strives towards becoming a leading producer, processor and exporter of Ethiopian forest, semi-forest and garden coffee of best quality. By linking the member cooperatives to the coffee market, the Union aims at improving the livelihoods of coffee farmers.

"Zukuka!' (tr. Wake Up!) is our ambition for the speciality coffee industry in Uganda; from crop to cup we endeavour to bring transformation through practical social enterprise.

We’re innovative, but we begin with what people have in their hands. Uganda has the conditions to produce fantastic coffee, and harnessing these we seek to breathe new life into a sleeping giant! Since 2016 we have been working to encourage excellence in coffee cultivation, processing and business practices on Mt Elgon, Uganda.

We  produce  Arabica coffee fully washed with score above 83.

name: Red Ecolsierra
description:
In 2001, Red Ecolsierra was founded in Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta mountains. Initially, and during the 2000s, the challenges were (a) the persecutions and fear spread by the illegal groups against the civilian population; (b) the little investment and state intervention in infrastructure in the region; and (c) skepticism about an agricultural model that promotes the protection and conservation of local fauna and flora.

Today, the commitment of 352 producing families is to harvest and market certified organic and fair trade coffee in international markets, and therefore have a better price. With this, the families receive organic and fair trade premiums, which finance infrastructure, environmental management, and product quality projects in their farms, also the premiums contribute to funds on social investment and marketing, and education.

name: FRIENDS OF MOTHERS INITIATIVE LTD
description:
Friends of Mothers Initiative Ltd (FMI) is a Fairtrade and organic certified coffee producer and exporter founded in 2016 and incorporated in 2017. FMI’s farmers are located on the slopes of Mt. Elgon and with a total 50 farmers, its production capacity is of 588,591 kg of exportable grade coffee.

FMI ltd is boosting the Ugandan agricultural sector to offer opportunities for growth, raising earnings and transforming lives of the farming communities. This is done through the improvement of coffee productivity as well as the provision of marketing and other support services to farmers.

FMI ltd is also implementing clean energy a project, which involves the distribution of improved energy-efficient cooking stoves to rural and urban households across the Mt. Elgon region. The goals of this project are to reduce carbon emissions into the atmosphere and to conserve the environment.

name: D'Brasil Organic Coffee - Fazendas Dutra
description:
D’Brasil Organic Mountain Coffee it is the organic coffee produced by Fazendas Dutra. 100% single origin and organic certified by National Organic Program (NOP), Canadian Organic Standard (COS), Japanese Agricultural Organic Standard (JAS), Ecocert Organic Standard (EOS) equivalent to the European Regulation.

D’Brasil Direct Trade is all about building lasting relationships that create the most mutual benefit. In this model, you can order your green coffee directly from us the producers.

name: Cooperativa de Caficultores de Caicedonia
description:
Caficaicedonia es una empresa creada en los años 60, por un grupo de caficultores, con el ánimo de proyectar hacia el mundo el sueño de la Caficultura, una actividad cafetera arraigada, tradicional, con esfuerzo, pujanza y valentía que con el pasar de los años ha afrontando todo tipo de adversidades, pero que ha mantenido la guardia en alto con el producto insignia del país; el café.
En el norte del Valle del Cauca, en la llamada Centinela del Valle Agremiamos a las familias cafeteras Caicedonitas, que grano a grano, cosecha tras cosecha y desde los 1.100 metros de nuestra cabecera municipal hasta los 2.000 metros sobre el nivel del mar de nuestras montañas han forjado la economía y una cultura cafetera de la cual hoy nos sentimos orgullosos. 
Acompañamos a nuestros Caficultores a producir el café más suave del mundo, que desde el grano hasta la taza, se viva una experiencia maravillosa al tomar un café de estas tierras, unas tierras productoras que día a día ofrecen al mundo el trabajo más arduo y constante de los caficultores que tienen como objetivo de vida ofrecernos su mejor actividad, la actividad cafetera.
Somos una Organización que tiene como 152 miembros asociados del municipio de Caicedonia Valle, llevando a ellos la garantía de compra (Café) Diferentes líneas de comercialización buscando siempre una sostenibilidad financiera y social para el productor, además de ofrecer un almacén agropecuario de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para sus necesidades y requerimientos.

name: The Coffee Quest Colombia
description:
The Coffee Quest Colombia is a green Specialty Coffee exporter with a focus on fully traceable, sustainably produced high quality coffee.
We are also exporters in Brazil and importers in Europe and the US, offering complete control of the supply chain from the two largest producing countries of Arabica coffee to some of the biggest coffee markets. We mostly purchase our coffees directly from smallholder farmers.
Besides our own companies, clients consist of importers in South America, Asia and the Middle East. Our coffees find their way to coffee small and medium size specialty roasters.

name: FUNZO COFFEE LTD
description:
We work closely with our farmer groups to get a wide range of coffees.
They make up who we are as Funzo, and as such we make sure they know how important they are to us.
We team up our farmers into groups so as to work together to gain a better yield.
We support our farmers to look after their coffee plants, harvest and handling after harvesting. The wait for the fruit to mature can be a daunting wait; But it ensures a higher and better yield. We encourage women farmers. Our Agronomist makes regular outreaches to our farmers.

name: Catur Coffee Company

La organización, nace el 21 de noviembre del año 2013, a raíz de la crisis de la roya del café del año 2012, con la finalidad de buscar oportunidades de desarrollo en forma organizada, desde entonces, han tocado puertas a las organizaciones ya existentes, con la finalidad de articularse y sin éxito, toda vez que también las organizaciones con mayor experiencia se encontraban en la misma situación de crisis después de la roya del café del 2012. 
Gracias al entusiasmo y compromiso de los productores, se han logrado conseguir los objetivos y metas trazados, logrando exportar el 2020, 7 cont.

For many years, the company was comprised of 1920 farmers. 

Today 2021, the company has the capacity of exporting 150 tons of green coffee per year.

We have formed a great working partnerships with reputable importers in Europe which allow us to export small quantities for small roasters whom will be interested in being agents of change in the value chain.

name: COOPEAGRI
description:
CoopeAgri El General R.L., es una empresa de economía social solidaria fundada el 25 de noviembre de 1962 en San Isidro de Pérez Zeledón.
Hoy, con más de cinco décadas y más de 6 mil asociados activos, se ha convertido en una empresa líder, que ha impulsado el crecimiento económico en la zona sur de Costa Rica, catalogándose como modelo en el ámbito nacional e internacional.
Se distingue por un alto sentido humanista gracias a su diversificación que abarca las áreas agrícola (producción propia de caña de azúcar, café, cacao y plátano), agroindustrial (producción y comercialización de café, azúcar y abono orgánico), comercial (seis supermercados, una tienda de conveniencia, dos almacenes de suministros agrícolas, estación de combustible y ferretería), y servicios (cafetería, clínica médica y área forestal).
Nuestra oferta de cafés va desde los convencionales HB y SHB Costa Rica, hasta procesos de altos estándares de calidad como SHB Funcy, Naturales y Mieles de excelente calidad.
Somos exportadores directos desde hace 25 años y contamos con un personal de experiencia deseoso de servirles.

description: La Florida Cooperative is an community of small coffee farmers with currently 821 coffee partners. All the members believe that is vital to care and support the natural cycle of the land having a balance ecosystem. Even though the cooperative is certified as a producer of organic coffee and in Fair Trade, now they are embarking in a new adventure to apply technology in two different aspects: to improve the coffee process and to present to their customers a transparent way to see the process and to know the people that are part of it.

name: DukundeKawa
description: Founded in 2000, The Dukunde Kawa Cooperative (Musasa) cultivates its high-quality coffee in the soil located between 1800 - 2200 m of altitude just near the mountain gorilla habitat in central Rwanda. By producing high-end coffee for the international market and employing a majority female workforce, the cooperative ensures maximum benefits to local families. Currently, Dukundekawa (Musasa Coffee) accounts 1176 coffee farmers which make it capable of producing up to 12 containers of green coffee per year. Fair Trade Certified since 2004, Dukunde Kawa secures a high standard of living for Rwandan farmers by ensuring access to an economically and environmentally sustainable coffee industry. Eighty percent of Dukundekawa's producers are women. The cooperative owns 4 dry mills(Ruli , Mbilima, Nkara and Musambira) all covering more than 392ha of arable land. the speciality coffee produced have a cupping score of 85 to 90.

name: CV Sidikalang Poda Agro
description:
CV Sidikalang Poda Agro originated from a cooperative that focuses on marketing the products of its members and coffee farmers in the highland of Northern Sumatra. This cooperative was established in 2009 and in 2016 sent coffee to the Dutch company. But in the beginning of 2017, the NGO which assisted the cooperative decided to stop the supporting and the cooperative stopped running. Meanwhile, members of the cooperative still wanted to continue to carry out the sale of coffee but there was no legal entity. While awaiting the improvement of the cooperative organization, the members proposed to establish a legal entity to carry out coffee buying and selling from and by the members.

To overcome the deadlock in marketing the coffee and also the wishes of the members who have felt the economic benefits of this marketing program, in September 2017 a legal entity with the name CV SidikalangPodaAgro was established. With the establishment of this company, we could resume marketing the coffee from Sidikalang Dairi area, Highland of Northern Sumatra. 

The main objective is to streamline the marketing chain from producers to consumers in order to increase the economic value both at the farm level and at the processing level, and buyers are able to get high quality coffee.

Now....I am looking for serious buyer who really want to have specialty coffee from Northern Sumatra.

name: This Side UP Coffees
description:
We are building a community of equal farmer and roaster partners.

Most coffee farmers do not have the means and connections to reach out directly to roasters, and are left to the devices of the open market and the whims of traders. Instead of keeping farmers in the dark while simply buying and selling their coffee, This Side Up aids farmers to become fully independent agro-entrepreneurs. This includes becoming their own coffee’s quality experts, ecologists, exporters, storytellers and introducing them to the European specialty coffee world.

name: BUFCOFFEE LTD
description:
Bufcoffee Ltd produces and exports green coffee beans, it was founded in 2003 by Epiphanie Mukashyaka, a dynamic business woman.  Epiphanie, who was born in 1959, was widowed during the 1994 genocide.  She set about rebuilding and developing her business and with it the local community. She started Bufcoffee in 2003, when she established Remera washing station with a loan from the Rwandan Development Bank and the assistance of the USAID-financed PEARL project. 

We have experience in managing well our budget, loan and support because we have significant staff with various skills.  
It has farmers which are grouped into 48 associations. Now owns four coffee washing stations - Remera, Umurage, Nyarusiza  and Ubumwe as well as its own coffee trees, and buys coffee cherries from smallholder farmers in their different local groups. It Bufcoffee has a large market at national and international level with many customers from different countries of the world such as: USA, Norway, Sweden, Japan, South Korea, France, United Kingdom, Belgium, and Australia. For sustainability of this company, we initiated Umuvumu Kindergarten project which helps the children from coffee farmers so that their parents get enough time to caring coffee trees. Bufcoffee distributes cows throughout its own initiated Heifer Project.
